text: around 1,000 homeless workers and
indigenous groups from central Brazil
marched towards the huge money get in
cess stadium in the capital Brasilia
dressed in traditional costumes some
with bows and arrows the protesters were
met in the middle of the highway by
armed riot police clad head to toe in
protective body armor the troops opened
fire with TIG s and stun grenades the
protesters scattered some turn to fire
their primitive weapons as they fled
seven World Cup games would be played in
the Brasilia Stadium the most costly of
Brazil's 12 venues which according to
some reports has cost nine hundred
million dollars to build that's money
say protesters that should have been
directed elsewhere to social housing and
other projects especially as Brasilia
doesn't even have a major football team
to use the stadium after the cup
but worryingly for the Brazilian
government these events perhaps confirm
their concerns there will be relatively
small but vociferous protests during the
cup itself and how Brazil's military
police deal with such demonstrations
under the gaze of the world's media is a
big question where a Davis BBC News Rio
de Janeiro
